name: spottily
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is sometimes good and sometimes bad, or only exists or happens in some parts or situations: The early contracts were hastily executed and spottily documented. Antibiotic-resistant germs are more likely to grow when people take the medicines spottily.
More examplesFewer examplesWorkers in the industry are trained spottily, if at all.Earthquake building regulations have been applied spottily. The older generation performs more spottily in this area.The country's military remains under-equipped and spottily supplied.
